greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A figurate number triangle read by rows.
comment: Row coefficients are the absolute values of the coefficients of the characteristic polynomials of the n X n matrices A(n) with A(n)_i,i=2, i>0, A(n)_i,j=1, otherwise (starts with (0,0) position).
The triangle can be generated by the matrix multiplication A007318 * A114219s, where
reference: G. Chiaselotti, W. Keith, P. A, Oliverio, Two Self-Dual Lattices of Signed Integer Partitions, Appl. Math. Inf. Sci. 8, No. 6, 3191-3199 (2014).
formula: Number triangle T(n, k)=if(k<=n, if(k=0, 1, binomial(n-k, k-1)((k+1)(n-k)+k)/k, 0), 0); T(n, 0)=1, T(0, k)=0, k>0, T(n, k)=T(n-1, k-1)+T(n-1, k)+binomial(n-2, k-1); Column k is generated by (1+kx)x^k/(1-x)^(k+1); rows are coefficients of the polynomials P(0, x)=1, P(n, x)=(1+x)^(n-2)(1+(n+1)x+x^2), n>0

A signed version arises from the coefficients of the polynomials defined by: p(x, 0) = 1; p(x, 1) =(x - 1); p(x, 2) = (1 - 3 x + x^2); p(x,n)=(-1 + x)^(n - 2)*(1 - (n + 1)*x + x^2); t(n,m)=Coefficients(p(x,n)). - _Roger L. Bagula_ and _Gary W. Adamson_, Oct 21 2008
mathematica: Clear[p, x, n, m] p[x, 0] = 1; p[x, 1] = (x - 1); p[x, 2] = (1 - 3 x + x^2); p[x, 3] = (-1 + x)* (1 - 4 x + x^2); p[x, 4] = (-1 + x)^2 *(1 - 5 x + x^2); p[x_, n_] := p[x, n] = (-1 + x)^(n - 2)*(1 - (n + 1)*x + x^2); Table[CoefficientList[p[x, n], x], {n, 0, 10}]; Flatten[%] (* _Roger L. Bagula_ and _Gary W. Adamson_, Oct 21 2008 *)
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Feb 06 2005
